text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Hariri said: "I do not think that there will be a war in the region because the world's super powers would not accept it".
- The Third Arab Capital Markets Conference ends its three-day meeting in Beirut today.
- The General Labour Confederation's complaint against the government has political aim, Labour Minister Hardan said.
- The parliament will nominate the Constitutional Council's new members in an extraordinary session on July 7.
- The parliament approved a law to establish a ministry for industry.
- British foreign minister will made an official visit to Lebanon next week.
